File /std/bit.c

The bit object is the object created to handle bits of corpses, like fingers and eyes and so on.

Written by Ember

Inherits

This class inherits the following classes std/object.c

Includes

This class includes the following files /include/corpse.h and /include/bit.h

Public Functions

These are functions that everyone can access.

.
add_bit_gone
mixed * add_bit_gone(string bit)
do_cure
void do_cure()
This method cures the corpse. A cured bit no longer decays.

do_decay
int do_decay()
This method is called by the bits controller to do the actual decaying of the object.

Returns:
1 if it still exists, 0 if it has finished decaying
do_eat
int do_eat()
The main eat entry point.

Returns:
1 on success, 0 on failure
extra_look
string extra_look()
make_bit
object make_bit(string which_bit)
This method creates a bit from the current bit.

Parameters:
which_bit - the name of the bit to create
Returns:
the object that is the new bit
make_bits
object * make_bits(string * what_bits)
This method makes a bunch of bits at once.

Parameters:
what_bits - the list of bits to create
Returns:
the array of made bits
no_decay
int no_decay()
THis method checks to see if the bit can inherently not decay. Like trolls teeth and other such things.

Returns:
1 if it cannot decay, 0 if it can
query_bit_data
mixed query_bit_data()
This method returns the bit data for the bit. The return array is of the format same format as used in the races.

Returns:
the bit data
See also:
/std/races/basic.c

Returns:

query_possible_bits
string * query_possible_bits(string word)
This method returns the possible bits that can be removed from this bit. If the bits are restricted then the possible bits are the ones that are contained by that bit.

Parameters:
word - restrict the possible bits
Returns:
the list of possible bits
query_possible_plural_bits
string * query_possible_plural_bits(string word)
This returns the plural of all the possible bit names. If the bits are restricted then the possible bits are the ones that are contained by that bit.

Parameters:
word - restrict the possible bits
Returns:
the array of possible bit names
